attributes.additional_details: The roads particularly in high traffic areas or where vehicles are accelerating, are getting to the point of being dangerous to drive on. Cars are meant to take a certain amount of abuse but not when the edges of potholes are so aggressive. If you drive over the degraded surfaces, you risk puncturing a tire, cracking an alloy or breaking a shock absorber etc. The councils don't have enough money to spend on repairing their roads and it's becoming more of a problem.
attributes.background: To repair all of the most badly damaged roads in the country. To spend on existing infrastructure instead of new infrastructure when the existing is in such a poor state. Every day the roads are deteriorating more and more, and many are unsafe to drive on. We need entire sections repaired.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition in its current form as it does not call for a clear action from the UK Government and Parliament. Local councils are responsible for repairing local roads. You could start a petition calling on the Government to provide local councils with extra funding to repair roads.
